news_header: China's new import taxes on American goods escalate the trade war, as Trump threatens more tariffs.
news_original_title: China's tit-for-tat tariffs on US take effect
news_text: China's tit-for-tat import taxes on American goods took effect as the trade war escalates. Trump announced a 25% tariff on steel and aluminum imports and hinted at reciprocal tariffs on other nations. China's tariffs include a 15% tax on US coal and LNG, and a 10% tax on crude oil and agricultural machinery. China also launched an anti-monopoly probe into Google and imposed export controls on rare metals. The US and China are in a tense trade relationship, with both sides making accusations and implementing tariffs.
